text: Hi, my name is Mike McGehee. Thank you for taking my course on solar cells.

In the beginning we'll take a look at what
solar cells can do and talk about what

the cost needs to be for them to compete
economically. Then I'll tell you a little

bit about the science of solar cells and
then we'll look at the different kinds

of solar cells, one at a time. I'm going
through silicon and thin film gallium

arsenide, multijunction organic, and
perovskites, and then finally at the end

we'll look at trends in the solar
industry and I'll give you my

predictions on where the industry is
going.
